intro: Rondeletia inermis var. intermedia, commonly known as the pink rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, showy pink or red flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its botanical characteristics include a woody stem and opposite leaf arrangement, making it a distinctive member of the Rubiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
